required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Prophylactic Antibiotics Therapy in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy on Infection Rate
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Control Study of Clinical Effectiveness of Prophylactic Antibiotics Therapy in Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy on Infection Rate

brief_summary.textblock:
529 patients performed elective LCC at Chonbuk National University Hospital between April 2014 and August 2015. Total 509 patients were enrolled by inclusion criteria.
They were randomized studied by comparing with antibiotic group (n=249, AG, cefotetan 1g, 1 dose/prophylactic) and non-antibiotic group (n=260, NAG) by table of random numbers. The clinical variables were pre and post-operatively blood tests enclude WBC, ESR, CRP, body temperatures, symptoms and imaging of chest x-ray to evaluate the infections.

detailed_description.textblock: 529 patients performed elective LCC at Chonbuk National University Hospital between April 2014 and August 2015. Total 509 patients were enrolled by inclusion criteria. They were randomized studied by comparing with antibiotic group (n=249, AG, cefotetan 1g, 1 dose/prophylactic) and non-antibiotic group (n=260, NAG) by table of random numbers. The clinical variables were pre and post-operatively blood tests enclude WBC, ESR, CRP, body temperatures, symptoms and imaging of chest x-ray to evaluate the infections.

arm_group.description: They were Antibiotic treatment group (AG, cefotetan 1g, 1 dose/prophylactic) before surgery.
They were Non-antibiotics treatment such as cefotetan 1g before surgery.

intervention.description: Cefotetan (as Disodium) 1 GM Injection before surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
patients who have diagnosed -cholecystitis with / without GB stone, GB polyp
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Suspected cholangitis and GB cancer
2. CBD stone history
3. Preoperative administration of antibiotics within 7days.
4. Suspected pregnancy
5. Open conversion.
6. Patients refuse this study
